title: Operations Manager Bank & Fintech
description:
*Vi på Iver ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till våra kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara ”beside you”, ”behind you” och ”before you”. Vi kallar det för ”The Iver way”.*
 Är du en driven och affärsorienterad ledare som vill göra skillnad i en snabbföränderlig och innovativ bransch? Vi söker nu en Operations Manager med starkt affärsfokus och leveransförmåga till vårt Bank & Fintech-team. Är du vår nya kollega?
   

  

**Om Iver**
 Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med expertis inom drift, cybersäkerhet, moln och innovation. Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder utan även för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.Med huvudkontor i Stockholm verkar Iver främst i Norden och har en agenda att fortsätta expandera. Iver har en omsättning på drygt 3 miljarder SEK och cirka 1 500 anställda som arbetar på något av våra 25 kontor i Norden.
   

  

**Din roll på Iver?**
 Bank och Fintech är vårt affärsområde som arbetar med kunder inom bank, försäkring och fintech. Samtliga kunder inom affärsområdet har mycket höga krav på informationssäkerhet och ser automation som en naturlig del av leveransen.
   

  

 I din roll som Operations Manager kommer du att leda ca 4- 6 gruppchefer och ansvarar för din verksamhet både utifrån ett affärs- och medarbetarperspektiv.
   

  

**Det Innebär B.la Att**
* Säkerställa synergier i de olika leveransteamen för bästa leveranskvalitet
* Prioritera resurser mellan teamen
* Tillsammans med dina ledare driva kompetensförsörjning och kompetensutveckling inom teamen för att möta morgondagens krav
* Driva och implementera ny teknik i samråd med arkitekt och ev. teknikchef


 Du kommer att arbeta nära våra kunder för att förstå deras behov. Rollen är en kombination av operativ styrning och strategisk utveckling och . Du kommer att följa upp ledarnas arbete för att säkerställa en kvalitativ leverans för kund, och skapa förutsättningar för dina ledare att lyckas i sina team.
   

  

 Du representerar din driftenhet i ledningsgruppen för vertikalen och bidrar till utveckling som helhet. Det är en mångfacetterad roll som ställer höga krav på dig och ditt ledarskap. För att lyckas i rollen skapar du samarbete mellan dina ledare och team, så väl som mellan din verksamhet och resten av Iver.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Iver - We empower our Nordic society. Hos Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. På Iver är vi inkluderande och strävar efter genuint samarbete där vi arbetar mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 Vårt ledarskap är tydligt och kräver styrkor i tre dimensioner, People, Business och Technology. Du har tidigare erfarenhet inom IT och tjänsteleverans mot kund och du har erfarenhet av att vara ledare över ledare med ett affärsansvar. Vi tror även att du i grund och botten har en teknisk förståelse inom IT-infrastruktur och erfarenhet av kraven på en IT-miljö inom bank/försäkring eller fintech.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen som Operations Manager tror vi att du har:
   

  

* Några års erfarenhet av leda ledare med personalansvar
* Hög teknisk kompetens inom relevanta områden och en bakgrund av tekniskt arbete
* Väl förtrogen med de tekniska utmaningarna och förutsättningarna för en IT-miljö inom såväl bank som fintech
* Erfarenhet av ekonomisk uppföljning och budgetansvar
* Erfarenhet av resource management
* Van att leda under förändring


**Som Ledare Är Du**
* Kommunikativ och trivs i en föränderlig miljö
* Har förmågan att coacha, leda och inspirera andra ledare
* Är en kulturbärare och visar vägen framåt
* Samarbetsvillig, tar ägarskap och hittar proaktiva lösningar
* Ansvarig för att leverans sker i linje med våra värderingar och vårt Brand Promise


**Placeringsort**
 Iver finns på 25 platser i Norden. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från vårt kontor i Solna, Stockholm.
   

  

**Övrig Information**
 Vi har kunder inom alla branscher och sektorer inklusive säkerhetsklassad verksamhet därför genomför vi bakgrundskontroller i samtliga av våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-02-23. Du är välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Niclas Karlsson (niclas.karlsson@iver.se) eller TA – Manager Jennie Vilhelmsson (jennie.vilhelmsson@iver.se) vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Välkommen till Iver!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: IT Business Controller
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Other
description:
Do you want to be involved in shaping the financial management of our IT initiatives in an international group? We are looking for an experienced IT Business Controller who is passionate about creating structures, analyzing data and linking operational performance to financial results. In this key role, you will work strategically and operationally in close collaboration with IT, finance and management teams to optimize costs and drive successful IT projects. Are you a structured and solution-oriented person who dares to challenge and find solutions that benefit all parties? Then this could be the role for you!
 



  





**About the role** 




 As an IT Business Controller, you will be a part of Group Business Control and have the overall responsibility for managing and monitoring the group's IT costs, ensuring that the financial and operational reporting within IT is accurate, up-to-date and compliant with applicable accounting principles. This role requires both strategic and operational skills, with a focus on linking operational performance to financial outcomes. You will report to the Head of Group Business Control and be part of the IT management team.
 



  





**Main responsibilities** 



* Be responsible for IT budget, forecasts, and KPI development to optimize costs and resource utilization.
* Identify efficiencies and implement cost-saving measures.
* Ensure accurate and consistent accounting and deliver reports on IT expenses and deviations.
* Support project managers with business cases and monitor financial goals for IT projects.
* Maintain internal controls and ensure regulatory compliance.
* Develop long-term financial strategies for IT investments and contribute to the overall goals of the business.



  





**Qualifications and personal qualities** 




 We are looking for someone with 5-10 years of experience in controlling, preferably within IT or project environment. You have strong analytical skills, are confident in making data-driven decisions, and have experience in developing and monitoring KPIs. Solid knowledge of financial reporting, budgeting and forecasting, as well as a good understanding of accounting principles and regulatory compliance are prerequisites.
 



  





 As a person, you dare to challenge and question the status quo and describe the current situation, even when it involves challenges. You find it easy to communicate financial outcomes linking them to drivers and put them in relation to previous communications. Your ability to adapt working methods and communication to the strengths of individuals and organizations is central, as much of the information is embedded in other people across the organization.
 



  





 You are a structured and solution-oriented individual who can sort information and create a synthesis based on what needs to be achieved. You switch with ease between details and a holistic perspective. In addition, you have the ability to establish processes that help teams work according to their strengths, creating sustainable and efficient ways of working.
 



  





 Fluency in both Swedish and English, written and spoken, is a requirement, and you are a strong team player who plans your and others' work to ensure that main activities start and end on time.
 



  





**Why Join Us?** 




 With us, you will have the opportunity to influence and contribute to strategic decisions in IT and finance in a dynamic organization. You will play a key role in shaping the financial governance of our IT initiatives and be part of a dedicated and professional team.
 



  





 This is a full-time position based at our headquarters in Lindhagen, Stockholm, with limited travel requirements. There is also the option for remote work one day per week.
 



  





**About Scandi Standard** 




 Scandi Standard contributes to the joy of food and sustainable food production through healthy and innovative chicken products, produced in a responsible and resource-efficient way. We have a stated commitment to long-term sustainability. This is translated both at Group level and in our local brands into concrete, standardized and measurable measures. We will be an industry leader in animal welfare and have as little climate impact as possible. That is why we take responsibility for the impact on people and the environment throughout the value chain – both in our own operations and in the supplier, transport and consumer chains.
 



  





 Scandi Standard is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm.

title: Senior Databasutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Tolka krav, ta fram lösningar, utveckla och säkerställa att kravet uppfylls Dokumentera förändringarna i intern och extern dokumentation
   

  

 Testa funktioner och tjänster
   

  

 Implementera och exekvera automatiska tester
   

  

 Kvalitetssäkring av databaser
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av utveckling med Oracle Databaser och PL/SQL. Minst 2 år av arbetslivserfarenheten ska vara förvärvad någon gång under den senaste femårsperioden
* Relevant akademisk examen inom it/data eller arbetslivserfarenhet som vi bedömer likvärdig.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 06-02-2024
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Cloud Arkitekt
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**OM ROLLEN**
 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens molnlösningar?
   

  

 Du blir en del av Capgeminis Cloud & Infrastructure Services (CIS)-enhet med fokus på projekt- och konsulttjänster i Norden. Vårt mål är att erbjuda kunder helhetslösningar inom Cloud och vi erbjuder en mängd olika tjänster till våra kunder, från strategisk rådgivning till projektgenomförande.
   

  

 Som Cloud Arkitekt kommer du att:
   

  

* Designa och implementera skalbara, säkra och kostnadseffektiva molnarkitektur, som uppfyller affärsbehoven
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att samla in krav, definiera tekniska specifikationer och utveckla molnlösningar, som är i linje med affärsmålen och främjar hållbarhet (GreenOps)
* Utvärdera molntekniker och tjänster för att rekommendera bästa praxis och lösningar för att optimera prestanda, tillförlitlighet och skalbarhet
* Designa och distribuera molninfrastruktur med hjälp av ledande plattformar som AWS, Azure och/eller GCP
* Utveckla och underhålla dokumentation, diagram och riktlinjer för moln-arkitektur
* Ge tekniskt ledarskap och mentorskap till juniora teammedlemmar, vilket främjar en kultur av kontinuerligt lärande och tillväxt
* Hålla dig uppdaterad gällande teknologier och branschtrender för att driva innovation och förbättra våra molnerbjudanden
* Arbeta nära kunder, partners och andra affärsenheter för att utveckla och genomföra innovativa och konkurrenskraftiga lösningar/projekt för nya och befintliga kunder genom att utnyttja dina tidigare erfarenheter av att implementera molnlösningar


**DIN PROFIL**
* Erfarenhet av att skapa högtillgängliga molninfrastrukturlösningar för stora organisationer
* Gedigen kunskap om funktioner och möjligheter hos AWS, Azure och/eller GCP
* God förståelse för cloud-native arkitektur, mikrotjänster, containerisering och serverlös databehandling
* Erfarenhet av verktyg för Infrastructure as Code (IaC), såsom Terraform eller CloudFormation
* Erfarenhet av att skapa greenfield-lösningar och implementera landningszoner enligt bästa praxis
* Erfarenhet av att snabbt utvärdera teknisk genomförbarhet och utveckla förslag för migrering av workloads till AWS, Azure och/eller GCP
* Kunskap om praxis och verktyg för ekonomisk drift (FinOps) för optimering och hantering av molnkostnader
* Certifieringar såsom AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert eller Google Professional Cloud Architect är meriterande
* Erfarenhet av nätverksintegration med AWS Direct Connect eller Azure Express Route samt nätverksdesign (WAN/LAN/brandväggar)
* Förståelse för hybridmolnlösningar och erfarenhet av att integrera offentligt moln i traditionella hosting-/leveransmodeller
* Svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of nearly 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2022 global revenues of €22 billion. Get the Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Testing & DevOps Automation Lead
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for a Desk Side Support to join our CIS DWP Digital support\DSS Team.
   

  

**About Cognizant**
 Cognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating, and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build, and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant (a member of the NASDAQ-100 and one of Forbes World’s Best Employers 2024) is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com
   

  

**Job Summary**
 We are seeking a detailed and result-oriented Test & DevOps Automation Lead with 10+ years of experience in IT. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in end-to-end testing, DevOps along with knowledge on Telecom/Networking. The role involves defining end to end automation frameworks, DevOps solutions and executing projects using agile methodologies.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Architect, design and implement automation frameworks.
* Implement and manage CI/CD pipelines to streamline automation processes and enhance deployment efficiency.
* Perform and oversee manual and automated testing, including mobility, integration, app performance, and compatibility testing.
* Ensure comprehensive test coverage through manual and automation testing
* Conduct penetration testing, speech quality testing using PESQ.
* Perform End to End system tests for MCPTT (Mission Critical Push to Talk) ecosystem.
* Facilitate daily Scrum meetings as required with the team and ensure timely completion of Sprint user stories and tasks.
* Actively participate in Agile ceremonies, contributing to product backlog planning and prioritization
* Ensure compliance with quality standards and best practices


**Required Skills**
* 10 - 14 years of experience with 5+ years of relevant experience in testing and automation
* Strong knowledge on testing methodologies and tools
* Experience working on Agile methodologies and tools like Jira, Confluence
* Knowledge on Containerization using Docker and CI/CD tools like Jenkins
* Knowledge on Python, Robot framework and Appium tools
* Domain experience on Telecom and Networking


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Bachelors Degree is Computer Science/Engineering or related field
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication and teamwork abilities
* Experience in handling customer interactions and technical requirements

title: Account Executive
description:
Build the future of the AI Data Cloud. Join the Snowflake team.
   

  

 The
 **Account Executive** 
 is responsible for building Enterprise level client relationships within the Swedish market. Individuals who excel at this job have the ability to prospect (via email, phone, & partner ecosystem), develop, and close business within a timely manner while focusing on the clients’ requirements. The AE’s must have the confidence and ability to negotiate and close agreements with clients and support new customers through our on-boarding process.
   

  

 This role is a unique opportunity to contribute in a meaningful way to high visibility, high impact projects at a very exciting time for the company. Snowflake is an innovative, high-growth, customer-focused company in a large and growing market. If you are an energetic, self-managed professional with experience managing a complex sales process and possess excellent presentation and listening skills, organization and contact management capabilities, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**AS AN ACCOUNT EXECUTIVE, YOU WILL:**
* Achieve sales quotas for allocated accounts on a quarterly and annual basis by developing a sales strategy in the allocated territory with a target prospect list, and a regional sales plan.
* Develop marketing plans with the marketing team to drive revenue growth.
* Be the trusted advisor to the customer by understanding their existing and future IT roadmap to drive the Snowflake solution within the marketplace.
* Prospect qualification and the development of new sales opportunities and ongoing revenue streams.
* Arrange and conduct initial Executive and CxO discussions and positioning meetings.
* Sales process management and opportunity closure.
* Ongoing account management to ensure customer satisfaction and drive additional revenue streams.
* Be familiar with solution-based approach to selling, have experience managing a complex sales process and possess excellent presentation and listening skills, organization and contact management capabilities.


**WE ARE LOOK FOR SOMEONE WITH:**
* 5-10+ years of full cycle sales experience selling software or cloud based applications to the mid-market
* Emphasis on cloud, databases, business intelligence software, data warehousing, SaaS is desired.
* Experience hitting quota of $1m+ of ARR per year and experience on averaging 8+ face to face meetings per week.
* A track record of success in driving consistent activity, pipeline development and quota achievement.
* Experience determining customer requirements and presenting appropriate solutions.
* Pro-active, independent thinker with high energy/positive attitude
* Excellent verbal and written communication in Swedish (native level), presentation, and relationship management skills
* Ability to thrive in fast-paced startup environment
* BA/BS required


 Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.
   

  

 How do you want to make your impact?

title: Senior Property Risk Engineer
description:
Are you interested in building a successful career at AIG working and to be part of the world’s leading insurance organization?
   

  

 AIG is currently looking for a Senior Property Account Engineer/Field engineer to join our Nordic Property organization as well as EMEA Engineering organization. The position will be based at our office in Stockholm and report into our Risk Engineering Manager.
   

  

 Our Commercial Property European Engineering organization consist of 60 engineers with 3 positions placed in the Nordic region. The Engineers works closely with the Property UW team and where much of the work is to service larger property accounts, where for this role the focus would be larger Nordic clients.
   

  

 Account Engineers (AE) form an integral part of the UW process and where AEs are the focal point of all Engineering activities. The primary focus for AE team is to service the accounts for our UWs and support them on risk selection and portfolio management. External Client Engagement include RI follow ups and annual meetings. Field engineering mostly pertain to performing HPR visits to large Nordic clients.
   

  

**Selection Of Key Responsibilities**
* Perform property loss prevention reviews of commercial property accounts
* Document the account review results in a data-driven application
* Conduct periodic client service meetings with underwriting, broker and client
* Analyze and manage risk improvements of an account and work with the client to prioritize and implement them
* Translate client needs and loss prevention strategies into a client service plan
* Estimate of the cost of engineering services
* Conduct quality reviews of completed account reviews and reviews of field survey reports
* Conduct property loss prevention surveys at key facilities of a client
* Determine building construction and assess the impact of plastics in construction
* Analyze water supplies and sprinkler system demands to determine water supply and sprinkler system adequacy
* Identify occupancy hazards and assess the adequacy of their protection features
* Identify and assess the impact of external exposures on a facility
* Determine fire and natural catastrophe loss estimates for a facility
* Conduct consultative visits at customer facilities and plan reviews


**Position Requirements**
 AIG strives to be a highly client focused organization, something that should be reflected in your social skills, personal structure and high quality in every output of work performed. We are looking for a team player who is technically skilled in the property field.
   

  

 Requirements:
   

  

  

* Few years property risk engineering experience (field risk engineering or account engineering)
* University degree in engineering
* Broad knowledge in Risk Property controls and experience in performing field risk surveys of commercial and light hazard industrial occupancies.
* Possess relationship management and strong interpersonal skills
* Fluent in Swedish and English


- 

 Preferred:
   

  

  

* Other Nordic language skills is preferred, such as Finnish or Danish
* 
* Excellent presentation and excel skills


 If you have any questions about the position or the recruitment process, please contact;
   

  

  

* Jasmin Eriksson, Junior HR-Generalist Nordics & Ireland - jasmin.eriksson@aig.com


**AIG Nordic**
 An interesting position in a dynamic environment where you will be part of a brilliant Nordic & European organization. AIG Nordic has offices in Stockholm, Copenhagen, Oslo and Helsinki. As a region, we work closely together and where we possess expertise in may different areas across the cluster.
   

  

**About AIG**
 American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a world leader in insurance and financial services, leading international insurance organization with operations in more than 100 countries and jurisdictions. AIG's common stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, as well as the stock exchanges in Ireland and Tokyo.
   

  

 AIG is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Read more at www.aig.com
   

  

**Reimagining insurance to make a bigger difference to the world**
 American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a global leader in commercial and personal insurance solutions; we are one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. It is an exciting time to join us — across our operations, we are thinking in new and innovative ways to deliver ever-better solutions to our customers. At AIG, you can go further to support individuals, businesses, and communities, helping them to manage risk, respond to times of uncertainty and discover new potential. We invest in our largest asset, our people, through continuous learning and development, in a culture that celebrates everyone for who they are and what they want to become.
   

  

**Welcome to a culture of belonging**
 We’re committed to creating a culture that truly respects and celebrates each other’s talents, backgrounds, cultures, opinions and goals. We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging through our flexible work arrangements, diversity and inclusion learning, cultural awareness activities and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). With global chapters, ERGs are a cornerstone for our culture of inclusion. The diversity of our people is one of AIG’s greatest assets, and we are honored that our drive for positive change has been recognized by numerous recent awards and accreditations.
   

  

*AIG provides equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.*
 AIG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants and employees with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation, please send an email to candidatecare@aig.com.
   

  

 Functional Area:
   

  

 UW - Underwriting
   

  

 Estimated Travel Percentage (%): Up to 25%
   

  

 Relocation Provided: No
   

  

 AIG Europe S.A Filial i Sverige

title: Senior D365 SCM Supply Chain Consultant
description:
Join our Nordic ERP team of talented professionals and contribute with your expertise to help organizations achieve operational excellence and drive successful digital transformations using Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP. We partner with some of the biggest companies across the world, working together to improve business outcomes. We help not only well-established organizations move into the digital era, but also support innovative start-ups as they build their businesses.
   

  

**We**
* Have a wide variety of interesting projects to work with both locally and globally
* Provide you with a dedicated Career Adviser to support you during your journey at Avanade and who works together with you to create a personal development plan
* Welcome you to a team of engaged and helpful co-workers
* Have a wide range of different benefits such as employee stock purchasing, flexible work arrangements, a commitment to diversity and inclusion
* Provide the opportunity to work for Microsoft's Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 tears in a row), with a wide variety of development and training opportunities (80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Have offices in the major Nordic cities, and we support flexible work locations.


**Come join us**
 ERP is all about helping businesses simplify complexity and thrive in the digital age. You’ll be solving your client’s challenges and turning their needs into goals and solutions through Microsoft Dynamics 365.
   

  

 This role provides the opportunity to work for the Microsoft 1 Partner, with an unrivalled focus on development, global opportunities as well as a dedicated career advisor to support you through your career progression.
   

  

**Skills And Experiences**
* Strong consulting skills and client-facing experience with an implementation partner
* You have a passion for learning along with good business sense and time management
* You know how to manage your clients’ expectations effectively
* You’ve likely achieved a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant field
* At least one full-cycle implementation of Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O or Dynamics AX OR experience supporting Dynamics 365 F&O as a strong user within the Supply Chain modules
* Experience with the Microsoft Dynamics 365 Supply Chain module
* Manufacturing and/or Supply Chain Management end-user experience nice to have but not required
* Experience managing/leading teams both on and offshore is nice to have, but not required


**About You**
 Characteristics that can spell success for this role:
   

  

* Consultative, collaborative, relationship builder
* Resilient, adaptable, flexible
* Intellectually curious and passionate about tech
* Convincing storyteller and engaging content creator


**What You'll Do**
 You will:
   

  

* Transform business requirements into a straightforward and technical model, and match processes to application requirements
* Prototype and configure processes in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations (F&O) to make sure the system works the way your client needs it to
* Run workshops with your clients, consultants, and client leaders to analyze and design solutions for any application, and handle gaps detected during prototyping
* Work with the technical team to make sure that your clients' needs are incorporated into the specifications and functions
* Create or evaluate a breakdown of your clients’ businesses processes so that you can identify and link functional and non-functional requirements
* Documents settings and prepare your clients to use the system
* Support testing the proposed system and train users


**Learn more**
 Apply today!
   

  

 To Learn more about Avanade Nordics, visit our home page.
   

  

 Interested in knowing what’s going on inside Avanade? Check out our blogs:
   

  

 Avanade Insights exchange ideas that drive tomorrow’s innovation
   

  

 Inside Avanade explore what life is like working at Avanade
   

  

**Enjoy your career**
 Some of the best things about working at Avanade
   

  

* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
* Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you


  

  

 Find out more about some of our benefits Employee Benefits at Avanade | Avanade
   

  

**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!
   

  

 We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page.
   

  

  

  

 Create a future for our people that focuses on

 Inspire greatness in our people by

 Accelerate the impact of our people by

title: Finance Manager
description:
Gazella rekryterar nu en Finance Manager till BEWI Group, ett innovativt företag som utvecklar förpacknings-, komponent- och isoleringslösningar med fokus på minimal miljöpåverkan. I denna roll kommer du att vara Finance Manager för en av deras divisioner inom downstream. Du får en central position och ett brett ansvar för att säkerställa att divisionens finansiella processer fungerar effektivt, korrekt och i linje med företagets mål. Du rapporterar direkt till VP Head of Finance DS och samarbetar nära organisationen för att driva utveckling och förbättringsarbete framåt. Här blir du en del av ett internationellt företag, noterat på den norska börsen, med ett fortsatt fokus på tillväxt och expansion framåt – både genom organisk tillväxt och strategiska förvärv. Tjänsten är placerad i Stora Frösunda, Solna.
 



  





 Är detta en resa du vill vara med på? Välkommen med din ansökan! Vi intervjuar kandidater löpande och ber dig därför att skicka in ditt CV redan idag.
 



  





**Vad erbjuder BEWI Group dig** 




 På BEWI Group blir du en del av ett företag där det händer mycket och där utveckling och förändring är en naturlig del av vardagen. De är ett dynamiskt bolag där alla medarbetare ges möjlighet att komma till tals och där idéer tas emot med öppet sinne. Med ett starkt fokus på hållbarhet och cirkulära lösningar arbetar de tillsammans för att skapa långsiktiga värden. Här uppskattas initiativ och engagemang, och du får möjlighet att bidra både till företagets framgång och till din egen utveckling.
 



  





**Din utmaning** 




 I rollen som Finance Manager kommer dina arbetsuppgifter bland annat att vara:
 



  




* Ta fram och färdigställa månads-, kvartals- och årsrapporter
* Ansvara för prognoser och rapportering till divisionsledningen
* Säkerställa korrekt rapportering
* Leda divisionens finansiella planering genom analys av utfall och identifiering av risker
* Proaktivt identifiera och driva förbättringsinitiativ i linje med strategin
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av lagar och regler
* Agera superuser för BI-system
* Etablera starkt samarbete mellan affärsområdena
* Utbilda och stödja kollegor
* Övrigt förekommande ad hoc-uppgifter



  





**Erfarenhet** 




 Vi söker dig som har en akademisk examen inom ekonomi och minst fem års erfarenhet av finansiell styrning. Erfarenhet från ett revisionsbolag är meriterande, likaså om du har arbetat i ett producerande bolag. Du är van vid att driva förändringsarbete och har förmågan att argumentera för förbättringar på ett effektivt och smidigt sätt. Du har erfarenhet av och fallenhet för att arbeta med olika IT-system, och det är särskilt meriterande om du har arbetat i Cognos.
 



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 För denna roll söker vi dig som snabbt sätter dig in i nya frågeställningar, drivs av resultat och är en lösningsorienterad person med stark handlingskraft. Du är flexibel men strukturerad, trivs med många kontaktytor och anpassar din kommunikation till olika målgrupper och situationer. Vidare uppskattar du att arbeta i en dynamisk och föränderlig miljö där du får bidra med både din analytiska förmåga och ditt engagemang för att självständigt driva förbättringar och leverera värde.
 



  





**Om BEWI Group** 




 BEWI Group är ett internationellt industribolag som fokuserar på att producera och utveckla hållbara förpacknings-, isolerings- och komponentlösningar. Bolaget är starkt engagerat i cirkulär ekonomi och arbetar aktivt med att minska sitt klimatavtryck genom återvinning och innovation. BEWI verkar inom flera affärsområden, inklusive råmaterial, färdiga produkter och återvinningslösningar, vilket gör dem till en integrerad aktör i värdekedjan. Med huvudkontor i Norge och verksamhet i flera europeiska länder, kombinerar BEWI lokal närvaro med en global vision. Läs gärna mer på deras hemsida: https://bewi.com/.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Ansökningar hanteras löpande. Passar du in på ovanstående profil? Ansök redan idag via ansök-knappen! Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Lovisa (lovisa.fast@gazella.se) som är ansvarig rekryterare för denna tjänst.

title: Senior Casualty Underwriter
description:
Interested in joining one of the largest insurance companies in the world?
   

  

 We are looking for a Nordic Senior Underwriter to join our Nordic Casualty UW operation. The role is based at our office in Stockholm and will report directly to our Nordic Head of Casualty.
   

  

 The team operates across all Nordic countries and Baltics and work closely with cluster distribution and commercial claims teams. The team consist of twelve underwriters located across the Nordic cluster, operating with products in both general liability (GL) and environmental (EIL). The Nordic team works closely with our UW specialist hubs across Europe, in both GL and EIL.
   

  

**Job description:**
 Successful individual will operate across both Casualty fields (GL and EIL) and together with the rest of the team, be in close contact with major clients and brokers across the Nordic region and to some extent the Baltic region. The job will also include supporting the younger part of the team in their UW development.
   

  

**Business Management**
* Monitoring and managing multiple distribution channels, partnerships, and brokers across the Nordic region
* Handling of large, multinational and complex accounts
* Ensuring successful execution of product development and underwriting (both GL and EIL)
* Measuring and reporting on operational issues, opportunities and development plans against company objectives
* Driving continuous operational improvement projects


**External Relationship Management**
* Representing AIG to major clients and brokers across the Nordic regio
* Expand and enhance the AIG Casualty brand across the region


**What we’re looking for:**
 We are looking for a senior professional who have many years of experience in the casualty UW field, potentially experience in both the EIL & GL. You are well connected in the region and enjoying building strong relationships in the various markets along with delivering strong UW excellence.
   

  

 In short:
   

  

  

* Senior UW track record in Casualty or/and EIL
* A “natural” with clients who can represent AIG effectively and support the introduction, establishment, and growth of valuable client relationships across Nordic market
* Proven ability to manage a broad range of stakeholders.
* Highly collaborative approach across functions and countries.
* Good communication skills in both English and a Nordic language
* Relevant University degree


 If you have any questions about the position or the recruitment process, please contact;
   

  

  

* Fredrik Forsström, Nordic General Manager, +46 704 19 40 81, fredrik.forsstrom@aig.com
* Alexander Sjöberg, HR Manager - +46 850692014 , Alexander.Sjoberg@aig.com


 American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. Building on 100 years of experience, today AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance, life insurance, retirement solutions, and other financial services to customers in more than 80 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets, manage risks and provide for retirement security.
   

  

**Reimagining insurance to make a bigger difference to the world**
 American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a global leader in commercial and personal insurance solutions; we are one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. It is an exciting time to join us — across our operations, we are thinking in new and innovative ways to deliver ever-better solutions to our customers. At AIG, you can go further to support individuals, businesses, and communities, helping them to manage risk, respond to times of uncertainty and discover new potential. We invest in our largest asset, our people, through continuous learning and development, in a culture that celebrates everyone for who they are and what they want to become.
   

  

**Welcome to a culture of belonging**
 We’re committed to creating a culture that truly respects and celebrates each other’s talents, backgrounds, cultures, opinions and goals. We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging through our flexible work arrangements, diversity and inclusion learning, cultural awareness activities and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). With global chapters, ERGs are a cornerstone for our culture of inclusion. The diversity of our people is one of AIG’s greatest assets, and we are honored that our drive for positive change has been recognized by numerous recent awards and accreditations.
   

  

*AIG provides equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.*
 AIG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants and employees with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation, please send an email to candidatecare@aig.com.
   

  

 Functional Area:
   

  

 UW - Underwriting
   

  

 AIG Europe S.A Filial i Sverige

title: IT Security Specialist
description:
Are you passionate about IT Security and ready for a new challenge? Join RaySearch as one of our IT Security Specialists and help us advance cancer care.
   

  

**About The Position**
 RaySearch develops state of the art oncology software used at clinics around the world to treat cancer patients in an efficient way. As an IT Security Specialist at RaySearch you will play a crucial role in ensuring the security and integrity of the secure software development life cycle and our IT infrastructure and the secure software development life cycle. Your primary responsibilities will revolve around implementation and maintenance of security measures to protect our systems and data while ensuring that product cyber security management activities and output are compliant with our procedures.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Coordinate cyber security management activities, including post market.
* Identifying vulnerabilities, design and implement protective measures, and ensure compliance with organizational policies and industry standards.
* Security monitoring and incident response.
* Regular security assessments and audit activities of products and infrastructure.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of security incidents, assessments, and measures.
* Support and training for development.
* Contribute to the development of strategic security plans that align with our broader business objectives.


**Your profile**
 We believe that you have proven experience in IT Security, which has given you a solid understanding of security principles, practices and technologies. You are analytical and possess excellent problem-solving skills that enable you to critically assess risks, develop robust solutions and make informed decisions that strengthens our security posture.
   

  

 We also believe that you are an independent and self-motivated individual who takes initiative. Since you will have regular communication with both internal teams and external stakeholders, we value your social skills, strong communication abilities, and your sense of responsibility.
   

  

 A collaborative mindset is essential, as you'll be working closely with diverse teams—including risk managers, testers, and core development teams—to implement a unified approach to security. Your ability to keep stakeholders informed about security issues, initiatives, and progress is a key part of your role, and we appreciate candidates who excel in fostering clear and open communication.
   

  

**Essential experience & skills:**
* Degree in Computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Experience with security monitoring tools and incident response procedures.
* Excellent written and spoken communication skills (English).
* Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or CEH are a plus.


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySearch is the driving force behind our organization
 **, where** 
 everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability
 **to deliver** 
 exceptional results,
 **pay** 
 close attention to detail, and consistently
 **go** 
 the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in
 **their** 
 field
 **, driven by** 
 a relentless focus on solving problems
 **-** 
 no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in
 **leading the way in** 
 cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative
 **solutions** 
 that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply to the position through the application form below. We do not accept applications by e-mail. Please note that we are approaching the holiday season. A response to your application may be delayed until January.

title: Android Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Truecaller transformed how we communicate when we launched in 2009 in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Our mission is to build trust everywhere by making tomorrow’s communication smarter, safer and more efficient. We focus on bringing smart services with big social impacts, like protecting people from fraud, harassment, and scam calls or messages. We identify new numbers from anywhere in the world and build a space for trustworthy conversations, for those that matter. Truecaller is loved by over 350 million people around the world and is growing very rapidly across regions.
   

  

**Who we are:**
* The world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS.
* A team of 400 people from :35 different nationalities, spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, Tel Aviv and Nairobi.
* Listed On Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap


 Tasks
   

  

**What Will You Work On**
* Write simple, understandable, testable, and efficient code with a focus on solid technical stability and great user experience.
* Drive technical improvement by applying software craftsmanship in everyday work as well as by identifying and executing larger refactoring/improvement initiatives.
* Contribute in implementation of complex features and design work.
* Being part of cross team technical projects
* Participate in and contribute to the team’s Agile practices.
* Implement unit tests within the team’s responsibility area.
* Take responsibility in maintaining high engineering standards, commitment to the product and respect and attitude towards others.nd respect and attitude towards others.


**Requirements**
**What do we expect from you**
* Strong knowledge of the Android SDK (minimum 2 years of experience)
* Familiarity with RESTful APIs
* Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
* Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
* Fluent in English, in speaking and writing
* Experience in working with Agile methodologies
* Ability to make the right compromises to maximize early value delivery without compromising on quality


**It would be great if you also have**
* Exposure to google billing library
* Strong knowledge of Android UI design principles, patterns, and best practices as well as an eye for design
* Knowledge of gRPC


**Benefits**
**What we offer:**
* A smart, talented and agile team: An international team where :35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance and pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone that you fancy the most within our budget ranges.
* Do it your way: We work in-office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays with flexibility on the other days. You can enjoy 3 weeks working remotely from anywhere you want per year.
* Office life: Enjoy your days with a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, and have fun at our playroom! As well, exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, Geek lunch!


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check. We are excited to hear from you, don’t hesitate to apply!
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**Come as you are:**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal and inclusive. We need a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs and experiences in order to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc.
 **All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.**

title: Senior testare
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll.*
 Din roll
   

  

 Vi söker nu en senior testare som vill jobba med oss på affärsenheten Naval Combat Systems. Här får du chansen att delta i arbete för att vidareutveckla världens främsta ledningssystem
 *.* 
 Som testare kommer du hantera mångsidiga uppgifter relaterade till testning av vårt stridsledningssystem för våra marina kunder. Du kommer ingå i en grupp av testare men jobbar i projekt och har daglig kontakt med projektets deltagare.
   

  

 I rollen som Testare kommer du att:
   

  

* Analysera systemkrav för att säkerställa korrekthet och testbarhet.
* Skapa detaljerade testspecifikationer och testplaner.
* Utföra manuell testning av stridsledningssystemet som levereras till våra kunder.
* Dokumentera och kommunicera avvikelser på ett tydligt sätt för att driva förbättringar.
* Prioritera och hantera testfall baserat på risk och komplexitet.
* Genomföra acceptanstester tillsammans med kund.
* Få möjlighet till att utveckla och implementera testautomatisering.


 Tjänstens placering är i Järfälla till en början, men framöver kommer delar av verksamheten att flytta till nya lokaler i Solna Strand. Resor förekommer i tjänsten.
   

  

 Din profil
   

  

 Som person är du verkligen en doer, villig att lösa alla problem som behövs för att hjälpa produkten och organisationen att gå framåt. Du har ett samarbetstänkande och är en lagspelare som uppmuntrar till ett öppet, förtroendefullt och innovativt klimat. Vi ser helst att du delar vår iver att lära sig ny teknik och att utmana status quo!
   

  

 Formella krav för att lyckas i rollen:
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av mjukvarutestning krävs för att snabbt kunna bidra till gruppens arbete och säkerställa hög kvalitet i våra leveranser
* Relevant IT-utbildning, såsom en kandidatexamen inom områden som datavetenskap, teknisk fysik, elektroteknik, systemvetenskap eller annan teknisk/naturvetenskaplig disciplin
* God kommunikationsförmåga i tal och skrift både på svenska och engelska


 Meriterande kompetens/erfarenhet:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i JIRA och Confluence
* Erfarenhet av Linux
* Erfarenhet från testautomatisering och relaterade skriptspråk och verktyg (t.ex. RobotFramework, PyTest)
* Erfarenhet av Nätverk
* Erfarenhet av icke-funktionella tester (t.ex. Last-, prestanda- eller säkerhetstester)
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta som Testledare


 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. Befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

 Vad du blir en del av
   

  

 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 24 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
   

  

 Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
**Om Rollen**
 Vi söker en erfaren och driven Senior DevOps Ingenjör för en av våra kunder i Stockholm. I denna roll kommer du att ha möjlighet att leda och utveckla CI/CD-strategier samt bidra till att modernisera DevOps-processer i en stor mjukvarudesignorganisation.
   

  

**Observera att säkerhetsprövning krävs som en del av onboarding-processen.**
**Ansvarsområden**
 Som Senior DevOps Ingenjör kommer du att:
   

  

* Utveckla, modernisera och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines och automatiseringslösningar
* Arbeta nära utvecklingsteam för att identifiera behov och implementera effektiva lösningar
* Bidra till utvecklingen av inbyggd mjukvara (embedded SW)
* Agera som ledare och ta initiativ för att driva strategiska förändringar inom DevOps
* Säkerställa hög kvalitet och effektivitet i kundens processer och produkter
* Spela en nyckelroll i att förbättra kundens verksamhet genom att kombinera teknisk expertis med starka kommunikations- och ledarskapsförmågor


**Requirements**
 För att lyckas i denna roll bör du ha:
   

  

* Omfattande erfarenhet och en dokumenterad framgång i att utveckla, modernisera och underhålla CI/CD- och DevOps-processer
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i stora mjukvarudesignorganisationer
* Gedigen erfarenhet inom utveckling av inbyggd mjukvara (embedded SW)
* Teknisk expertis inom verktyg och teknologier såsom Git, Jenkins, Python, Java, Linux och Bash
* Stark drivkraft, ledarskapsförmåga och utmärkta kommunikationsförmågor
* Förmågan att arbeta kundorienterat och samarbeta med olika intressenter
* Svenska kunskaper och svenskt medborgarskap är obligatoriska


**Benefits**
* Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmånspaket
* Möjligheter till professionell utveckling och karriärframsteg
* Samarbetsinriktad och innovativ arbetsmiljö

title: Principal Sound Designer
description:
***If you’re looking to make the best co-op games in the world, you’ve come to the right place. We're proud to have some of the best game makers and collaborators in the industry working with us. What's more, we're a fun bunch of game developers, who love to indulge in our passion for video games together. Our games are not for everyone. Are they for you?***
 We are now looking for a Principle Sound Designer
   

  

 As a Principal Sound Designer, you will take ownership of the audio pipeline at Arrowhead, driving the immersive soundscape of our games to new heights. You will lead the audio direction, set quality benchmarks and mentor the team, ensuring Arrowhead’s audio quality reflects our game vision.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Define and lead the audio direction, establishing workflows, structures, and best practices to meet the needs of our projects.
* Define and implement high-quality audio assets for key game elements, including enemies, player actions, environments, and UI.
* Collaborate with other disciplines to align audio standards with the overall game vision.
* Set quality benchmarks for sound design, mixing, and implementation across internal and external teams.
* Assess and select audio vendors and partners, ensuring they align with our quality and creative standards.
* Partner with IT to identify and implement reliable and cost effective hardware and software solutions.
* Work closely with the Art Director to establish music direction.
* Lead innovation in audio, pushing creative and technical boundaries.
* Oversee and conduct location SFX recording sessions to deliver authentic, immersive soundscapes.
* Provide hands-on support to internal and external audio teams, troubleshooting and refining as needed.
* Mentor and guide all sound designers at all levels, providing constructive feedback and empowering them to excel.
* Regularly review and improve audio workflow processes to enhance efficiency and output quality.


**Requirements**
* Proven experience as a senior or principal sound designer in an in-house game development environment.
* Strong ability to create and integrate high-quality sound assets as key gameplay elements.
* Mastery of industry-standard audio production and post-production software, hardware, pipelines, workflows, and processes.
* Experience planning and conducting location SFX recording sessions.
* Excellent organizational skills with the ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects; while maintaining high-quality standards and meeting deadlines.
* Proven experience with Voice Design and VO pipelines.
* Proven Experience with technical audio design and audio propagation systems.
* Collaborating with in-house and off-site sound teams and programmers.
* Understanding emotion and tension in storytelling and being able to tell a story through sound.
* Solid understanding of recording techniques, microphone placement and having the ability to direct voice talent.


****How to apply****
 If you think that this position matches your background and skills, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your CV in English as soon as possible. We ask that your application always include relevant work samples or a link to your portfolio.
   

  

 We interview candidates continuously and hire when we find a good fit.
   

  

**Practical Information**
**Scope:** 
 Full-time: 40 hours per week with initial 6 month probation period.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Office first, hybrid solution possible. You need to be eligble to work in Sweden.
   

  

**We are a pet friendly office! You can expect to find dogs and occasionally some cats around.**
**What We Offer**
 Arrowhead Game Studios is a growing team of about 100+ people, best known for our co-op titles. Despite our size, we remain a friendly and down to earth bunch, who love to indulge in our passion for video games together.
   

  

 Located in a newly built, custom-tailored offices on the Hammarby Kaj waterfront, we enjoy everything Stockholm has to offer. A thriving game dev scene, along with all types of activities are immediately available on our doorstep.
   

  

 Our talented developers are crucial to our success, therefore we put a lot of emphasis in creating and maintaining a prosperous culture. We’re committed to open and transparent communication. Your ideas are welcomed, valued, appreciated - the ceiling for creative discussions is high.
   

  

 We also have numerous work benefits for all our employees. You can read about them here!

title: Global Account Manager (GAM) - EU
description:
**Job Description**
**Company** 
 :
   

  

 Cogent Communications is a multinational, Tier 1 facilities-based ISP, consistently ranked as one of the top five networks in the world and is publicly traded on the NASDAQ Stock Market under the ticker symbol CCOI. Cogent specializes in providing businesses with high speed Internet access, Ethernet transport services and is one of the only US providers who own and operate their own fibre infrastructure spanning the US for diverse Wave connectivity. Cogent's facilities-based, all-optical IP network backbone provides IP services in over 235 markets globally. Since its inception, Cogent has unleashed the benefits of IP technology, building one of the largest and highest capacity IP networks in the world. This network enables Cogent to offer large bandwidth connections at highly competitive prices. Cogent also offers superior customer support by virtue of its end-to-end control of service delivery and network monitoring.
   

  

**Position Overview:**
 The Global Account Manager is responsible for identifying and securing new business opportunities globally. By employing consultative selling techniques and relationship-building strategies, you will work directly with the nation’s leading IT Decision Makers to position Cogent's connectivity solutions. This role involves proactive outreach through direct calling, email, and onsite meetings, with a strong focus on understanding clients' current and future connectivity needs. Success in this position will be measured by meeting or exceeding monthly revenue goals and establishing Cogent as a trusted partner across commercial and retail buildings, carrier-neutral hotels, data centers, and colocation facilities.
   

  

**Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Identify, qualify, and secure new business opportunities within a global sales territory, focusing on market segments who require IP transit, Wave connectivity, Ethernet, Colocation and IPv4 services.
* Use direct calling, email outreach, and customer meetings to connect with Key Decision Makers and generate new business opportunities.
* Employ consultative and relationship-driven sales approaches to identify prospective clients’ current and future connectivity needs.
* Position Cogent’s services as the preferred choice by leveraging our extensive global network footprint, which spans commercial and retail buildings, carrier-neutral hotels, data centers, and colocation facilities.
* Collaborate with internal teams to ensure customer needs are met and expectations exceeded.
* Maintain and update detailed records of sales activities in CRM systems, tracking progress, and managing customer relationships.


**Qualifications** 
 :
   

  

* Telesales experience in any industry, with B2B sales experience being an advantage
* Proven ability to identify, qualify, and generate new business opportunities through proactive prospecting and research.
* Strong communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to engage effectively with Key Decision Makers.
* Self-motivated, positive, and proactive, with a passion for adding value to clients and excelling in a competitive, revenue-driven environment.
* Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, team-oriented and competitive environment with revenue-driven goals and rewards.
* Familiarity with CRM systems and basic proficiency in Microsoft Office are beneficial.
* Telecommunications experience or knowledge of connectivity solutions is advantageous but not essential.
* Cogent operates a global sales model so foreign language skills are an advantage


**Work Environment:**
 This is an in-office position, five days a week, designed to support your success through focused mentorship, training, and personal coaching.
   

  

 To apply for the Global Account Manager position, please submit your resume and cover letter to careers@cogentco.com .
   

  

 Cogent Communications is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Senior DevOps konsult
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Jobbeskrivning**

  

* Migrering av källkodshanterings system (GIT) i Bitbucket och Gitlab.
* Bygga, underhålla och migrera pipelines i GITLAB till GITLAB SaaS.
* migrera pipelines i Team City till GITLAB.
* Flytta vår AWS kontostruktur till ny organisation
* Drifta och förbättra våra k8s kluster
* Migrera från vår nuvarande Domän till ny domän.

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**

  

* Självgående, agil och resultat fixerad.
* Kunskap om AWS, AWS kontohantering och administration.
* Linux server i AWS miljö.
* GitLab (SaaS och Self-managed)
* Bygga och underhålla pipelines i GITLAB.
* Kubernetes, administration, drift och övervakning
* Kunskap i python och terraform

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 31-01-2025  

  

**Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Konsultuppdrag | DevOps resurs
description:
**Profil:**

* Självgående, agil och resultat fixerad.
* Kunskap om AWS, AWS kontohantering och administration.

title: Senior System Architect
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**

  

* Enable future proof target solutions that comply with process architectural and digital enterprise architecture principles.
* Work with the Enterprise Architects, Product Managers, Agile Team Managers, Development teams, Business Analysts and the business Stakeholders to specify how the requested solution will be designed and delivered to cater for and support the requested capability and process.
* Aligning and coordinating delivery with Architects and Tech Leads to ensure sustainability and compatibility in solutions.
* Collaborating within and outside the team and cluster to secure resilient solutions and shared technical design.
* Taking part of modernization efforts – Technology evaluation, Technology upgrades, Transforming business targets and end-states to digital roadmap solutions for Supply Chain.
* Lead, guide and coach the dev. teams in solution development and implementation.

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**

  

* You have hands-on experience within automotive industry, preferable within the area of Supply Chain and Logistics.
* Strong technical background in software development and IT infrastructure
* You have experience in managing and leading IT transformation projects
* Knowledge of Microsoft Azure Cloud and how to build scalable E2E Supply Chain solutions.
* Experience of COTS, SaaS and in-house developed software Supply Chain.
* Experience of OtD (Order-to-Delivery) process.
* Experience of working in a global supply chain context (Americas, EMEA, APAC)

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
