title: Azure DevOps Engineer
description:
*Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens teknik och skapa nya tjänster och automationer för Advanias kunder inom Cloud Transformation? Är du teknikdriven, gillar att samarbeta i ett tight team och vill arbeta med Azure och moderna utvecklingsverktyg? Då är detta din chans!*

**Som Azure DevOps Engineer på Advania**
----------------------------------------


Du blir en del av vårt team Special Solution Group, som är en del av Advanias största affärsområde, Managed Services Provider.  

Hos Advania får du möjlighet att arbeta med:

* Automation och utveckling i Azure: Utveckling av tjänster och lösningar för deras Azure-erbjudanden med hjälp av verktyg som t.ex. Azure DevOps.
* Kundleveranser och lösningar: Stödja deras kunder i att etablera och optimera sina molnmiljöer.
* Möjlighet att bidra till arkitektur och säkerhet beroende på intresse.


De arbetar i mindre team med stort fokus på samarbete och innovation.

**Vi söker dig som:**

* Har 2–3 års erfarenhet av Azure och är van att arbeta med molnautomation och utveckling.
* Har erfarenhet av verktyg som PowerShell, Azure DevOps, och gärna även Bicep. Erfarenhet av TypeScript eller andra programmeringsspråk är meriterande.
* Har en bakgrund inom infrastruktur och har gått mer mot automation och utveckling.
* Talar flytande svenska.

**Personliga egenskaper:**

* Problemlösare: Du gillar att ta dig an utmaningar och hitta kreativa lösningar.
* Lagspelare: Samarbetar gärna och stöttar dina kollegor för att nå gemensamma mål.
* Kommunikativ: Du är tydlig och van att arbeta i en miljö där mycket sker på distans.
* Resultatinriktad: Du ser till att få saker gjorda och levererar med kvalitet.

**Varför Advania?**  

Advania erbjuder en innovativ arbetsmiljö med högt i tak, där du får möjlighet att vara med och forma framtidens teknik. Här blir du en del av ett sammansvetsat team som prioriterar samarbete och personlig utveckling. Dessutom får du chansen att utvecklas inom området Cloud och arbeta med den allra senaste tekniken.

  


### **Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**

Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.


Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut.


I den här rekryteringen samarbetar vi med Professionals Nord. De kommer att sköta rekryteringsprocessen och alla frågor kring tjänsten går via ansvarig rekryterare Jennifer Ahlberg, jennifer.ahlberg@pn.se alternativt till info@pn.se
company_description: Advania är ett techbolag som utformar skräddarsydda lösningar och skapar hållbara värden genom smart användning av teknik.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer (GCP) - Remote
description:
#### **Senior DevOps Engineer (GCP)**

**About the role:**


As a DevOps team member, you will have the opportunity to take responsibility for ensuring that our data-intensive infrastructure is reliable, scalable, and high-performing to provide the best possible experience for our customers.  

  

Help us build an innovative platform that enables seamless, real-time transactions, including instant fund transfers between our app and exchanges. Your work will focus on solving complex engineering challenges that bridge traditional and crypto financial services, driving cost-effective, 24/7 access to digital finance.


From optimizing high-performance trading systems to enhancing liquidity and market-making tools, you'll be at the forefront of engineering solutions in the fast-paced fintech space.


Join us remotely, you can be located anywhere around the CET time zone, as our work is 100% online. The position is full-time.  

  

**About ICEO:**


We are a venture builder that has been creating innovative startups for the past 10 years. We’re on a mission to accelerate growth, enhance operational capabilities, and secure investments for our portfolio companies. With a team of more than 130 people from 25 countries, we leverage repeatable company-building processes and best practices to derisk scaling and increase the probability of success. Our multiple exits so far stand as a testament to that. Join us to build the future together!

  


#### **In this role, you will:**

* Design, develop, and maintain infrastructure within GCP and GKE, focusing on high and low-level performance optimization with security, availability, and reliability at the core
* Collaborate with developers to organize CI/CD practices and provide ongoing support throughout the software development lifecycle
* Create comprehensive documentation for implemented solutions
* Research and explore emerging solutions in the market for potential adoption
* Build and maintain automation tools to streamline software development processes at all stages
* Balance security requirements with team flexibility and collaboration
* Work closely with cross-functional teams
* Participate in daily stand-ups and planning meetings

#### **What we expect from you:**

* 7+ years in technology, with at least 3+ years in a DevOps, SRE, or similar role
* Strong experience in managing platforms autonomously, with a focus on risk assessment and decision-making
* Proficient in at least one programming or scripting language (Bash, Python, GoLang)
* Hands-on experience with Linux administration (Debian/Ubuntu) and containerization (Docker)
* Familiar with networking (LAN/WAN, Firewalls, Load Balancers, HTTP(s), DNS, SSH, TCP/IP)
* Expertise in CI/CD systems, version control, Kubernetes, and Helm
* Experience with public cloud platforms (GCP, AWS, Azure) and Infrastructure as Code tools (Terraform)
* Knowledge of scalability, high-efficiency systems, and monitoring tools (Grafana, Prometheus)
* Proficient in English (B2+ level)

#### **Why it’s worth a try - advantages of working at ICEO:**

* **Remote-first company** - we enable you to work from anywhere in the world.
* **Flexible working hours** - we understand the challenges of juggling the personal and professional lives. That is why we have core working hours between 11 am and 3 pm CET, offering you the opportunity to choose when you work outside of those hours
* **38 days PTO** - you have 38 days of paid time off per year, such that you can recharge and relax.
* **Learning & development**. Opportunity to grow by accessing internal and external learning & development programs.
* A **modern technical stac****k** with an emphasis on quality

#### **Recruitment Process:**

* Screening with Talent Acquisition Partner
* First interview with the Hiring Manager
* Technical Challenge Interview with DevOps Team

 **Salary:**


EUR 70 000 - 84 000 EUR / yearly net on Full-Time Independent Contractor Agreement

#### **Want to know more?:**

* take a look at our profile on Clutch and find out what our clients say about us
* visit our website and check who we have helped to succeed

title: Build Engineer
description:
MSAB is seeking a skilled Build Engineer to join our Build & Deploy team. This team is responsible for continuously packaging MSAB software in the formats that our customers demand. This includes both classical formats such as Windows-installers, and modern distribution mechanisms such as docker-images and Terraform configurations. Additionally, the team manages, configures, and maintains our CI/CD platform, TeamCity.


Our CI/CD environment is complex, with numerous dependencies across software projects that require careful oversight and management. To thrive in this role, you should have strong logical reasoning skills and excellent written and verbal communication abilities, particularly when collaborating with developers and other stakeholders.

#### **Responsibilities**

* Create, modify and troubleshoot MSI-packages for key MSAB products
* Collaborate with development teams to create, modify, monitor and troubleshoot CI/CD-projects for automatically building MSAB products
* Practically execute the MSAB release process in cooperation with our release manager

#### **Qualification requirements**

* Relevant post-secondary education within Tech (B.Sc, KY, etc.)
* Knowledge and practical experience with PowerShell and Python
* Experience working with CI/CD platforms (GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps, etc.)
* Experience with Git and similar developer tooling
* Strong communication and collaboration skills

#### **Highly Meritorious**

* Deep knowledge of Git
* Experience with InstallShield and MSI packaging
* Experience with TeamCity
* Experience with CI/CD for C++ (e.g., VCPKG, etc.)
* Experience with CI/CD for .NET (e.g., NuGet, etc.)
* Interest and experience in agile leadership roles such as Scrum Master or Kanban facilitator

#### **What we can offer...**


Create a safer world with us!


As one of the world’s leading digital forensics companies, MSAB leads the way in pioneering advancements that contribute to making our world safer.


Your work at MSAB will bridge the gap between technology and justice. You’ll be inspired to go beyond your comfort zone, and you’ll deal with challenging and meaningful projects. When you join us, you become part of a global team that aspires to create a safer digital future, one breakthrough at a time.


We can offer you an exciting work environment, where we value being innovative, acting ethically and delivering results in everything we do while our customers' needs are at the center. We are proud to be a fast-growing international company with more than 20+ nationalities and we work with things that really make a difference.


Every day at MSAB is an opportunity to redefine the future of digital forensics.

title: Senior Cloud & DevOps Engineer
description:
- **Är du en duktig molningenjör som älskar att nörda ner dig i både tekniska lösningar och molnmigrering? Då kan Devoteam M Cloud vara platsen för dig!**  

  

Är du redo att ta på dig din mantel och delta i äventyret?
  

Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
  

  

**Devoteam** är ett ledande internationellt konsultföretag som arbetar med digitala transformationer. Vi har över 10 000 kollegor i 20 länder. I den här rollen får du jobba från vårt nya fräscha kontor i Malmö, i ett svensk team mot stora Norska kunder.
  

  

Vi på **Devoteam M Cloud** är specialiserade på Microsoft Azure och blev bland annat utsedda till Partner of the Year (Norge) av Microsoft 2023. Vi söker nu fler duktiga kollegor som vill vara med och skapa fantastiska molnresor för våra kunder. Hos oss möter du en miljö som inte bara handlar om teknisk innovation, utan också om att ha roligt på jobbet! Våra medarbetare brinner för att leverera de bästa lösningarna inom Azure, optimering och modernisering.

  
**Ansvar**

* Utveckling av infrastruktur som kod (IaC) och automatisering av manuella processer och distributioner.
* Underhålla och utveckla kundrelationer.
* Anpassa dig till oväntade utmaningar och hitta de bästa lösningarna för kunden.
* Utföra uppgifter enligt kundens interna processer och respektera deras arbetsmetoder.
* Utveckla och implementera infrastrukturtjänster i Azure

  
**Kvalifikationer**  

  

Den rätta kandidaten bör ha kunskap och erfarenhet av Azure infrastruktur, och ha en förståelse och erfarenhet av GitHub (GitHub Actions) eller liknande CI/CD-verktyg.
  

Du behöver ha praktisk erfarenhet av minst ett av följande:


* Terraform/Bicep og Powershell
* Det är bra med erfarenhet från något programmeringsspråk (C++, Python, Ansible, Javascript etc.).
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att jobba med Infrastruktur som kod (IaC) och script
* Minst 3 års praktisk erfarenhet med molntjänster (Azure, AWS og Google Cloud)
Kunskap om Azure-infrastruktur  
* 

  

**Personliga egenskaper**

* Du har ett strukturerat arbetssätt och förmåga att se både helheten och detaljerna
* Du är lösningsorienterad och har en proaktiv inställning till problemlösning
* Stark förmåga att samarbeta, samtidigt som du tycker om att arbeta självständigt
* Du är nyfiken på ny teknik och vill ständigt utveckla din kompetens

  
- **Vi erbjuder:**


	* Möjligheten att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö med spännande kunder och projekt
	* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor och utvecklingsmöjligheter inom både teknik och karriär
	* En professionell miljö där kunskapsdelning och kontinuerligt lärande är en del av kulturen
	* Tillgång till de senaste tekniska verktygen och plattformarna för att effektivt lösa komplexa utmaningarHos oss får du möjlighet att använda din expertis för att bygga framtidens

title: Senior DevOps konsult
description:

**Jobbeskrivning**
* Migrering av källkodshanterings system (GIT) i Bitbucket och Gitlab.
* Bygga, underhålla och migrera pipelines i GITLAB till GITLAB SaaS.
* migrera pipelines i Team City till GITLAB.
* Flytta vår AWS kontostruktur till ny organisation
* Drifta och förbättra våra k8s kluster
* Migrera från vår nuvarande Domän till ny domän.


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Självgående, agil och resultat fixerad.
* Kunskap om AWS, AWS kontohantering och administration.
* Linux server i AWS miljö.
* GitLab (SaaS och Self-managed)
* Bygga och underhålla pipelines i GITLAB.
* Kubernetes, administration, drift och övervakning
* Kunskap i python och terraform


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 31-01-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**OM ROLLEN**
 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens molnlösningar?
   

  

 Du blir en del av Capgeminis Cloud & Infrastructure Services (CIS)-enhet med fokus på projekt- och konsulttjänster i Norden. Vårt mål är att erbjuda kunder helhetslösningar inom Cloud med branschspecifik expertis, avancerad molnteknik och globala resurser. Vi erbjuder en mängd olika tjänster, från strategisk rådgivning till projektgenomförande.
   

  

 Syftet med rollen är att hjälpa kunder att ta till sig och nyttja den fulla potentialen i Public Cloud och du kommer att leda och arbeta i tvärfunktionella projekt. Du kommer att ingå i en community av likasinnade, skickliga cloud engineers och vara delaktig i att driva standardisering, policys och best practise för åtaganden inom Norden. I mindre team tillsammans med andra engineers från olika expertområden kommer du att bygga hållbara och pålitliga plattformstjänster. Du kommer att använda både open source-tekniker och leverantörsbaserade lösningar.
   

  

**DIN PROFIL**
 För att vara framgångsrik i rollen har du stor erfarenhet av att designa och implementera tekniska lösningar och verktyg i AWS, Azure eller GCP. Du bör vara van vid projekt- och konsultarbete och kunna engagera dig var som helst i projektets livscykel, från inledande kunddiskussioner enda fram till automatiserad leverans och hantering av plattformsmiljöer som utnyttjar DevOps.
   

  

 Vidare ser vi gärna:
   

  

* Praktisk erfarenhet av AWS-, Azure- och/eller GCP, helst med leverantörscertifieringar
* Erfarenhet av migrering, implementering av landningszoner och/eller Financial Operations (FinOps)
* Praktisk erfarenhet av Kubernetes och Docker Containers
* Praktisk erfarenhet av automation och orkestrering med verktyg som Packer, Terraform, Cloud Formation
* God kunskap inom cloud networking och lastbalansering
* Exponering och förståelse för automatiserad build pipeline, continous integration och continous deployment – samt erfarenhet av att implementera verktyg som stödjer dessa metoder
* Scripting-kunskaper i minst en av följande: Go, Ruby, Python
* Erfarenhet av Linux
* Kunskap om DevOps-koncept, aspekter och verktyg
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leverera i agila miljöer
* God kommunikationsförmåga i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt


 Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of nearly 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2022 global revenues of €22 billion. Get the Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Systemutvecklare
description:
Brinner du för utveckling och letar efter en ny spännande och meningsfull utmaning? Hos Amendo Tech får du chansen att arbeta i framkant inom systemutveckling för några av Sveriges mest spännande företag. Just nu söker vi drivna och lösningsorienterade specialister för kommande uppdrag inom bank och finans, detaljhandel, myndigheter, produktbolag och snabbväxande startups. Vi erbjuder unika möjligheter för dig som är redo för en ny, stimulerande utmaning.
   

  

 Din kompetens & profil
   

  

 Du är erfaren inom systemutveckling och bekväm med både front- och backend, redo att skapa lösningar som gör skillnad. Vi letar efter dig som är nyfiken, engagerad och som trivs med att arbeta på varierande uppdrag.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att arbeta med några av dessa teknologier:
   

  

**Frontend**
* JavaScript/TypeScript: Gedigen kunskap inom modern JavaScript/TypeScript.
* Ramverk: Erfarenhet av ramverk som React, Vue eller Angular.
* HTML & CSS: Stark grund inom HTML5 och CSS3, gärna även erfarenhet av Bootstrap eller Tailwind.
* State Management: Kunskaper i bibliotek som Redux eller Vuex.


**Backend**
* Programmeringsspråk: Erfarenhet av språk som Node.js, Java, C#, Python eller Go.
* API-design: Skicklighet i att utveckla och designa RESTful API, gärna även GraphQL.
* Databaser: Kunskap i både relationsdatabaser (t.ex. PostgreSQL, MySQL) och NoSQL (t.ex. MongoDB, Redis).
* Säkerhet: Erfarenhet av säkerhetsprinciper och autentisering som OAuth, JWT eller SAML.


**DevOps och Infrastruktur**
* Molnplattformar: Erfarenhet av molntjänster som AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud Platform.
* CI/CD: Kunskap om CI/CD med verktyg som Jenkins, GitLab CI eller GitHub Actions.
* Containrar: Erfarenhet av Docker och gärna även Kubernetes.
* Versionshantering: Flytande i Git och vana vid Git-baserade arbetsflöden.


**Övrigt**
* Testning: Kunskap i testautomatisering, både frontend och backend (t.ex. Jest, Mocha, JUnit, Selenium).
* Agilt arbete: Erfarenhet av Scrum eller Kanban.
* Kommunikation och samarbete: Förmåga att arbeta effektivt i team och bidra till kunskapsutbyte.


 Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.
   

  

 Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.
   

  

 Om Amendo Tech
   

  

 Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.
   

  

 Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.
   

  

 Frågor och kontakt
   

  

 Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**Job Opening: Full-Stack Engineer (Malmö, Sweden)**  
*Location: Malmö (1-2 times onsite per week required)*

**About Us**  
At Arj Global Ltd, we are driven by a passion for building innovative, scalable, and robust cloud-based solutions. Our team thrives on collaboration, clean code, and delivering high-quality software that powers modern web applications. We are looking for a dedicated **Full-Stack Engineer** to join our team and help us achieve our ambitious goals.

**Role Overview**

Are you a team player passionate about building scalable cloud solutions, deploying microservices, and developing APIs for modern web applications? Do you take pride in writing clean, maintainable code while working collaboratively in a dynamic environment? If so, this is the perfect opportunity for you!

**Key Responsibilities**

* Build, deploy, and maintain microservices in cloud environments.
* Develop responsive, accessible, and performant web interfaces using modern JavaScript frameworks.
* Create and maintain RESTful APIs and scalable backend services.
* Design, implement, and manage CI/CD pipelines to ensure smooth and reliable deployments.
* Collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders to align project goals and translate requirements into actionable technical solutions.
* Stay updated with industry trends and contribute to driving technical improvements within the team.

**RequirementsTechnical Expertise**

* **Proven Experience**: 5+ years as a Full-Stack Engineer with expertise in backend and frontend development.
* **Frontend**: Proficiency in modern JavaScript frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js. Experience in building responsive and accessible web interfaces.
* **Backend**: Hands-on experience with Node.js, Python, or Java. Proficiency in designing and integrating SQL and NoSQL databases.
* **Cloud & Microservices**: Experience deploying and maintaining microservices in cloud environments (AWS, GCP, or Azure). Familiarity with containerization (Docker), orchestration (Kubernetes), and infrastructure as code (Terraform).
* **CI/CD Pipelines**: Knowledge of tools like GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or equivalent for automating deployments and testing.

**Soft Skills**

* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Ability to facilitate discussions between technical and non-technical teams.
* Team player with a growth mindset, committed to sharing knowledge and learning from peers.

**Nice to Have**

* Interest or experience in localization, internationalization, or multi-language support.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract  
Contract length: 12 months

Pay: 300,00kr - 450,00kr per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Work Location: In person

Expected Start Date: 05-02-2025

title: Cybersecurity Pre-Sales Expert - Cloud Applications
description:
**We help the world run better**

At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.

**Cybersecurity Pre-Sales Expert – Cloud Applications (Location: Sweden, Denmark, Finland, or Norway)**

  

We are seeking a **Cybersecurity Pre-Sales Expert** to join our team in a senior **Solution Advisor** role. This position works with sales teams to provide cloud security and compliance expertise in complex and strategic sales opportunities.

  

The ideal candidate will bring a strong technical background in cloud security and possess excellent communication and stakeholder management skills. They will excel at engaging with senior security professionals in customer organisations, serving as a trusted advisor and subject matter expert.

 **Key Responsibilities**

* **Security Subject Matter Expert**: Act as a focal point for SAP sales-related security matters across the Nordic and Baltic counties, ensuring alignment with customer security needs.
* **Comprehensive Cloud Expertise**: Provide deep knowledge of cloud security across all deployment models, including Hyperscaler environments, hybrid models, and SAP hosted solutions.
* **Stakeholder Engagement**: Build credibility with customer security and governance experts, acting as a peer and trusted advisor.
* **Hyperscaler Security Knowledge**: Demonstrate a thorough understanding of Hyperscaler security models, operations, and best practices.
* **Customer-Centric Solutions**: Assess the current security landscape of customer environments, identify goals, and translate these into SAP’s security offerings.
* **Sales Enablement**: Deliver impactful security-focused presentations, workshops, and demonstrations, while contributing to trusted advisor activities, RFIs, and RFPs.

 **What We’re Looking For**

* A proven track record in cybersecurity, with expertise in cloud security solutions.
* Strong ability to engage, influence, and collaborate with senior security stakeholders.
* Experience navigating complex environments and designing security strategies for enterprise-level cloud transformations.
* In-depth knowledge of Hyperscaler security operations and governance practices.
* Exceptional presentation and communication skills, with the ability to simplify complex concepts for a diverse audience.

  

This role provides an exciting opportunity to shape the security strategies of leading organisations, helping them confidently navigate their journey to the cloud. If you thrive in a collaborative environment and have a passion for solving security challenges, we’d love to hear from you.


**Bring out your best**


SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.

**We win with inclusion**


SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.  

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com  

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:**


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.  

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

title: SAP SuccessFactors Data Management Specialist
description:
**\*\*Flexible work locations in Sweden or Lisbon Portugal\*\***  

Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.  


Role Summary  


Scania Group is seeking an experienced, hands-on SAP SuccessFactors data management specialist to ensure the highest quality of HR data within our global system landscape, including the full SuccessFactors suite.  


The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in managing HR data governance, quality, and availability within a large, multinational organization. This operational role requires full responsibility for ensuring data quality control, governance, and continuous improvement within our HR systems, particularly SAP SuccessFactors.  


As a technically skilled expert, you will be passionate about operational excellence and data integrity. The role demands someone who thrives in a hands-on, detail-oriented environment and takes pride in promoting best practices and leading by example across the organization.  


As a hands-on SAP SuccessFactors data management specialist, you will play a critical role in ensuring the integrity and quality of HR data within a large, global organization. You will have the opportunity to lead improvements, drive data-driven decision-making, and promote best practices across the organization.  


Responsibilities  


* **Data Quality Control:**
	+ Take ownership of HR data quality across global HR systems, particularly SAP SuccessFactors, ensuring data is accurate, complete, and up-to-date.
	+ Continuously monitor, validate, and correct data to maintain integrity and accuracy.
* **SAP SuccessFactors Expertise:**
	+ Leverage deep knowledge of SAP SuccessFactors (full suite) to manage, troubleshoot, and improve data quality across the global system landscape.
	+ Act as a technical expert to ensure global data accuracy, reliability, and seamless operation.
* **Data Governance:**
	+ Enforce data governance practices to ensure compliance with internal standards, policies, and global regulations.
	+ Lead the creation and maintenance of comprehensive data catalogues and documentation, ensuring clear communication of data governance principles across the organization.
* **Training & Education:**
	+ Develop and deliver training programs to educate HR teams and business stakeholders on data handling practices, ensuring consistency, security, and alignment with Scania’s wider goals.
* **Project Management:**
	+ Lead HR data-related projects to improve data availability and governance, ensuring timely and successful execution.
	+ Collaborate with global teams to implement data improvements, track milestones, and drive data-driven decisions.
* **Analysis & Reporting:**
	+ Use data analysis tools to proactively identify data inconsistencies and opportunities for improvement.
	+ Produce regular data quality reports for global stakeholders and engage teams in following data governance best practices.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration:**
	+ Work closely with HR, IT, and other business units within TRATON Group to understand data requirements, resolve data issues, and ensure high-quality data availability across the organization.
* **Continuous Improvement:**
	+ Regularly review and refine working practices to drive improvements in data collection, governance, quality control, and reporting.

Qualifications  


* **Proven Experience:**
	+ 5+ years of hands-on experience managing global HR data in SAP SuccessFactors within a large multinational organization.
* **SAP SuccessFactors Expertise:**
	+ In-depth knowledge and hands-on operational experience with SAP SuccessFactors, particularly Employee Central.
	+ SAP SuccessFactors certification in Employee Central, SAP Analytics Cloud, or Reporting and Analytics is strongly preferred.
* **Data Management Expertise:**
	+ Proven track record in taking personal responsibility for HR data quality in global systems.
	+ Experience in creating and maintaining data catalogues and utilizing data validation tools.
* **Backlog Management:**
	+ Experience managing and executing service request backlogs effectively.
* **Project Management Skills:**
	+ Strong project management capabilities, with experience leading cross-functional teams on HR data initiatives.
	+ Proficiency in using project management tools to track progress and outcomes.
* **Analytical Mindset:**
	+ Data-driven and analytical, with a passion for investigating and improving data quality.
	+ Skilled in identifying trends and issues to drive actionable improvements.
* **Detail-Oriented:**
	+ Excellent attention to detail and a hands-on approach to ensuring data integrity across all HR systems.
* **Technical Leadership:**
	+ Ability to lead technical discussions and act as the subject matter expert in global working groups focused on HR data within SAP SuccessFactors.

Who You Are  


* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to take full ownership of data quality and governance.
* Ability to balance operational work with long-term improvement projects.
* A proactive, hands-on specialist who collaborates well with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Passion for data management and a continuous improvement mindset.
* Opportunity to coach and develop others within the team and across the organization.

  


Application  


Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.  


Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-01-31. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.  


If you have questions or would like more information about the role, please contact hiring manager Yolandi Menton, yolandi.menton@scania.com  


**We look forward to your application!**

description:
**\*\*Flexible work locations in Sweden or Lisbon Portugal\*\***  

Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.  


Role Summary  


Scania Group is seeking an experienced professional to lead the technical management of HR data across global systems. This role is key to ensuring data accuracy, availability, and consistent use within Scania’s HR ecosystem. You will play a pivotal role in enabling digital HR initiatives aligned with Scania’s roadmap by developing a unified data strategy and implementing and managing a global data model across the system landscape. Additionally, fostering data literacy across HR and related departments will be a central focus. This is a hands-on leadership role requiring deep SAP expertise.  


Responsibilities  


* **Team Leadership:** Manage and mentor a small team of data and privacy professionals with varying expertise, promoting operational excellence and ensuring compliance with reporting needs.
* **Data Strategy:** Develop and implement data management plans by interpreting organizational needs, translating them into actionable activities, and delivering results for Scania’s stakeholders.
* **Data Management:** Oversee the maintenance and enhancement of HR data systems (e.g., SAP SuccessFactors, Cornerstone LMS, Degreed LXP), ensuring integration and alignment across platforms.
* **Governance:** Ensure the availability, usability, integrity, and security of data in enterprise systems by applying internal data standards and policies. Utilize stakeholder engagement forums to implement data governance frameworks, maintain data quality, and ensure regulatory compliance.
* **Role-Based Permissions:** Manage SAP SuccessFactors data security and role-based permissions (RBP), with expertise in audits and compliance frameworks. Analyze complex permission structures to recommend scalable solutions and align with global data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
* **Change Leadership:** Advocate for informed decision-making, drive data literacy, and represent Scania in data transformation projects.
* **Collaboration:** Partner with cross-functional teams to address data challenges and enhance Scania’s analytics capabilities.
* **Compliance:** Ensure adherence to global data protection standards and internal policies.

  


Qualifications  


* **Experience:** At least 10 years of experience in enterprise HR systems management, with a focus on SAP SuccessFactors and technical activities related to global HR data initiatives.
* **Technical Expertise:** Strong knowledge of SAP SuccessFactors structures, data governance, and HR reporting tools. Experience with ServiceNow, Cornerstone on Demand, or Degreed LXP is a plus.
* **Leadership:** Proven ability to lead international teams, manage complex projects, and deliver results at a global scale. Experience in data implementation and system decommissioning is advantageous.
* **Certifications:** Certifications in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Business Technology Platform, or related core modules are essential.
* **Compliance Knowledge:** Familiarity with global data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and their impact on data management.
* **Change Management:** Proficiency in leading change initiatives and fostering data literacy within an organization.

If you have questions or would like more information about the role, please contact hiring manager Yolandi Menton, yolandi.menton@scania.com  


**We look forward to your application!**

title: Senior Critical Environment Electrical/ Mechanical Technician
description:
As a Senior Critical Environment Technician (CET) in Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) team, you will maintain the critical infrastructure that keeps our Datacenters up and running. This could be anything from coordinating with supplier/vendors, working closely with Management to address operational, risk and safety situations, mentoring other CE Technicians, having a hands-on understanding on how critical environment equipment works, performing various types of maintenance, responding to onsite incidents while coordinating with other critical facilities professionals, and using telemetry and other platforms to monitor equipment performance and operations.  

Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I Critical Environment Technician, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development of all employees and offers training and opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion training and events, and professional certifications.  

Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 200 datacenters in 32 countries and millions of servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.  

With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider.  

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

**Responsibilities:*** Serve as an operations specialist in one major area of CE operations (e.g., electrical, mechanical, controls, generators) and works on advanced tasks independently.
* Inspect and supervise critical environment-related facility equipment (e.g., controls, heating, ventilation, and air conditioning [HVAC], mechanical systems), building, and grounds regularly for unsafe or abnormal conditions and escalate per applicable policies and standards.
* Utilize internal computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) to track all equipment assets and to complete work order requests for maintenance work.
* Safely and quickly respond to and leads onsite incident response teams for all abnormal conditions that impact operations, and coordinates with other critical facilities professionals to perform corrective repairs without supervision.
* Enhance, develop new or follow preexisting emergency operating procedures (EOPs), methods of procedure (MOPs), and standard operating procedures (SOPs) in relation to CE operations and incidents.
* Perform various types of maintenance (e.g., planned, predictive, corrective) and repairs following methods of procedure (MOPs), and standard operating procedures (SOPs) for CE equipment (e.g., electrical, mechanical, cooling systems) and escalate when appropriate.
* Have a hands-on understanding of how equipment works and how to troubleshoot equipment, systems, subsystems, and components independently within their trained discipline(s).
* Provides consultation to lower-level colleagues in troubleshooting systems and problems.
* Understands, follows, and ensures safety and security requirements (e.g., job hazard assessments [JHAs], environmental health and safety (EH&S), toolbox talks), and business processes and procedures to properly perform work in a safe, quality, and reliable manner in accordance with applicable federal, state, local, and Microsoft requirements.
* Embody our culture and values

**Qualifications**
------------------

**Required Qualifications:*** High School Diploma, GED, or equivalent AND extensive mission critical services work/applied learning experience (e.g., high availability assembly/manufacturing/critical infrastructure environments such as data centers, oil and gas refineries, hospitals, pharmaceutical, manufacturing, or related fields)  

	+ OR equivalent experience.
* Experience in a specialized area (e.g., mechanical field, electrical field, controls field) or related field.

  

* Ability to work shifts, including shift assignments during non-standard business hours that may include evening, nighttime, weekends, and/or holidays

**Background Check Requirements:**
Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:* Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


While not required, we also look for the following **Preferred Qualifications****:**  

* High School Diploma, GED, or equivalent AND extensive mission critical services experience (e.g., high-availability assembly/manufacturing/critical infrastructure environments such as data centers, oil and gas refineries, hospitals, pharmaceutical, manufacturing, or related fields)
	+ OR Associate's Degree or technical trade certification (e.g., military, trade school), or higher-equivalent education AND extensive mission-critical services experience (e.g., high-availability assembly/manufacturing/critical infrastructure environments such as data centers, oil and gas refineries, hospitals, pharmaceutical, manufacturing, or related fields)
	+ OR equivalent experience.

  


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Technical Account Manager
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Technical Account Manager to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists.**

**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**


Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.


Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.


Today, we employ around 300+ employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Technical Account Manager who wants to make a difference.

**Managed Services**
  

Truesec helps customers globally with Attack Prediction Services, Vulnerability Management Services and Managed Detection & Response services for IT and OT environments. Our services are all delivered by skilled security analysis teams that conducts 24/7 attack monitoring, threat hunting, threat intelligence analysis, and threat remediation. Our team of experts works tirelessly to identify and prevent cyber breaches, and to help increase our customers’ proactive cybersecurity defenses. Our goal is to be an extension of our customers’ IT organizations, customizing a combination of capabilities and tooling, tailored to prevent cyber attacks in the most efficient way.

**The Role**  



You will be the customer's technical main contact. On a monthly basis you will analyze and present summarized reports of our customers' security postures, from our service perspective, and be keen to catch any challenges connected to the service.


Your role will include:

* Participation in operational and strategic meeting as part of the customer team
* Development and presentation of operational reports to our customers
* Responsibility for a group of clients being their primary point of contact for any technical issues regarding the service
* General advice and interpretation of customer needs and Truesec's services
* Helping the customer on their cybersecurity journey utilizing the full range of services Truesec can offer

**Your Potential Background**


We think that you have an excellent technical understanding combined with strong communication skills in order to present and understand both customers and internal stakeholders.


Required Skills:  

* Operational experience in cyber security monitoring, or similar experience working with technical MSSP services
* Minimum 2 years working in a customer facing role
* Ability to respond rapidly, multi-task, and communicate effectively both verbally and in writing with customers, team members, and engagement managers
* Hands on experience in EDR, NDR and/or SIEM
* Outstanding written and verbal communication skills

Bonus Skills:  

* Understanding of common threat actor techniques, malware behavior and persistence mechanisms
* Understanding of Active Directory services
* Understanding of general network structure and network components
* General server and client platform understanding
* Knowledge about cloud security controls and administration, geared specifically towards Azure.
  

Given the nature of our work, candidates should hold Swedish citizenship, citizenship within an EU country, or possess a valid Swedish work permit.

 **Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**  

If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.


So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Product Marketing Lead
description:
**Xensam: SAM Disrupters**  

Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.


We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.

**About the role**  

Are you a master storyteller who can transform complex technology into compelling customer value? As the guardian of our product positioning, you'll shape how we communicate the value of our fast-growing Software Asset Management platform to the world.  

  



As our Product Marketing Lead at Xensam, you'll be the storyteller who bridges our R&D innovations with customer needs. Working within our dynamic marketing team and reporting to the CMO, you'll own our product narrative across all channels.


**Responsibilities**


* Guard our product positioning to ensure consistent product messaging in collaboration with R&D and marketing teams.
* Craft compelling content that transforms technical features into business value.
* Drive product launch campaigns and regular release communications across multiple channels.
* Design lifecycle marketing messages within product notifications and communications.
* Conduct market research and customer interviews to shape our narrative.
* Transform technical documentation into customer-friendly communications.
* Co-create brand awareness campaigns for product positioning.

**Qualifications**


* 2-3 years of product marketing experience, ideally in B2B SaaS.
* Bachelor in marketing, business or tech, with additional education (course, certification, or diploma) in writing.
* Exceptional writing skills in English with the ability to simplify complex technical concepts.
* Strong analytical capabilities for market and customer insights.
* Proactive approach and structured working style.
* Excellence in cross-functional collaboration and stakeholder management.

**Bonus points if you have**


* Technical writing background.
* Confidence in front of the camera for video content.
* Presentation and webinar experience.
* Previous experience in Software or SaaS Asset Management.

**What you get**

* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* Free access to beverages, snacks, gym facilities, on-site massage, shuffleboard, and other games.
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.


At Xensam, our core values define our culture:

**Rebellious**: We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.

**Humane**: We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.

**Harmonious**: We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.



Ready to own our product story? **Apply now with your resume and a writing sample that showcases your ability to transform technical concepts into compelling narratives.**

As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Senior Consultants to the Telecom, Media & Technology team (Stockholm)
description:
**Senior Consultants to the Telecom, Media & Technology team (Stockholm)**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Join Capgemini Invent's dynamic team in the Nordics and unleash your passion for the Telecom, Media & Technology (TMT) industry!**  

**As a key player in our digital innovation powerhouse, you will drive end-to-end digital transformations and enhance customer experiences for leading companies. With a rich 55-year heritage and a diverse global team of over 360,000, Capgemini combines strategy, technology, data science, and creative design to tackle complex challenges and unlock new value. We empower CxOs to envision the future across nearly 40 studios worldwide while staying ahead of industry trends—such as 5G, Edge Cloud, AI-driven automation, and sustainability initiatives —to deliver actionable insights and transformative projects for our clients. We are actively seeking Senior Consultants to join our expanding TMT Consulting Unit. This is your opportunity to make a significant impact in the telecom sector and be part of a trusted advisory team that shapes the future of TMT!**

**Who are we looking for?**
---------------------------

  

* **Passion for Telecom: Strong interest in how technology impacts business within the Telecom, Media, and Tech sectors**
* **Experience: 2+ years in management consultancy, telecom operators, media, or hi-tech companies in roles such as product management, marketing, or business development**
* **Digital Transformation: Familiarity with digital operators and large transformation programs is preferred**
* **Team Player: Excellent communication skills and a commitment to delivering high-quality results**
* **Proactive Mindset: Entrepreneurial spirit with a strong drive for continuous learning and personal development**
* **Education: Master’s degree in Business Administration or Engineering from a reputable university**
* **Language Skills: Fluency in English; proficiency in Nordic languages is a plus**

  

**You will join our TMT team at our modern office in Stockholm, Kungsholmen, just a short walk from T-Centralen, featuring panoramic views of the city. Please note that travel and client site work will be required.****Does this sound like your next opportunity? Are you ready to create the future you desire? Apply now by submitting your CV in English. We look forward to hearing from you!**

**ABOUT CAPGEMINI**  

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**

title: Head of Outsourcing
description:
**Location:** On-Site Stockholm, Sweden

**Start Date:** Q1 2025

**Seniority level:** Expert/Management

**Contract type**: Full-time employment


‍

### **About Envar Studios**


‍


Love working on games, animations, and other creative projects?


Join us at Envar Entertainment! We're a passionate team on a mission to become the best studio in the world. At Envar, we believe in a quality-focus, fun, and supportive environment where your skills are truly valued.


At Envar, we thrive in a collaborative and flexible atmosphere and we foster a culture of creativity, feedback, and innovation ensuring smooth operations in a dynamic environment. If you are passionate about building a successful, productive team while maintaining high-quality standards, we’d love to hear from you!


‍

### **Your Role**


‍


As the **Head of Outsourcing**, you will manage and direct our outsourcing operations, reporting directly to our CEO, Atey Ghailan. You will oversee the quality, health, and efficiency of the studio’s processes and outputs. By leading a talented team and setting high standards for productivity, client service, and collaboration, you will play a key role in shaping the future of our studio.


This is an in-house position based in **Stockholm**, where you will lead the department, ensure alignment across teams, and optimize the studio’s outsourcing pipeline to meet our clients’ expectations and internal goals.


‍

### **Key Responsibilities**


‍

* **Studio Leadership:** Direct the studio toward achieving its vision, mission, and strategic goals, fostering a healthy work culture. Take ownership of the Outsourcing Department. Serve as the main point of contact across the company and cross-functionally aligning with the other departments of the company.
* **Outsourcing Department Oversight:** Oversee all aspects of the outsourcing department, including hiring needs, assigning tasks, scheduling, and performance standards on team’s deliveries.
* **Team Alignment:** Coordinate that all teams are aligned in terms of company goals, communications, leadership qualities and general approaches
* **Pipeline Optimization:** Identify opportunities and take ownership of pipeline improvement, creating processes and tools to support efficient workflows.
* **Client and Stakeholder Management:** Serve as the primary point of contact for the outsourcing department, building and maintaining strong client relationships and managing both internal and external stakeholders.
* **Budget Management:** Efficiently manage budgets to maximize project outcomes.
* **Growth and Development:** Build and evolve the outsourcing department by identifying, recruiting, and nurturing talent; work closely with the Business Developer to secure and allocate projects.
* **Direct Leadership:** Manage leaders of multiple teams within the outsourcing department, assigning tasks, setting goals, and ensuring project deliverables are met with the help of Art Leads and Project Managers.
* **Risk Mitigation:** Anticipate risks and adapt project scope and timelines to budget considerations, ensuring optimal outcomes for the department.


‍

### **Qualifications**


‍

* **Experience:** 8+ years in the video game industry or a similar field, including 4+ years in a leadership or management role focused on art production.
* **Industry Knowledge:** Deep understanding of creating and producing art and game assets for video games, also experience working with external development teams.
* **Technical Proficiency:** Proficient in management software such as Adobe Creative Cloud, Miro, Microsoft Office Suite, G-Suite, and art management tools.
* **Leadership Skills:** Proven ability to lead and inspire cross-functional teams, managing both creative and business objectives.
* **Budget Expertise:** Skilled in budget management with a strategic, business-minded approach.
* **Adaptability:** Flexible and able to navigate unexpected changes in project scope and timelines.


‍

### **Bonus Points**


‍

* **Project Management:** 2+ years of experience managing projects using Waterfall, Agile, or hybrid methodologies.
* **Technical Art Skills:** Knowledge in 2D art, 3D art, and animation.


‍

### **What We Offer**


‍

* **Dynamic, Innovative Environment:** Be part of a forward-thinking team that encourages creative solutions and process improvements.
* **Strong Company Culture:** Work in a supportive, collaborative atmosphere with direct impact on the company’s direction.
* **Startup Spirit:** Less restriction, more control, and direct feedback—your work will have a meaningful impact on the studio.
* **High-Quality Focus:** A quality-driven work environment where excellence is prioritized.
* **Creative Freedom:** Enjoy autonomy in problem-solving and innovation, with creativity encouraged at every step.
* **Positive Team Environment:** A fun, collaborative team with positive energy and strong teamwork.
* **Multicultural Work Setting:** Work with diverse, talented individuals from all over the world.


‍

##### **Are you ready to lead Envar Studios to new heights?**

##### **‍**

##### **If you have any questions about the position please contact soledad@envarstudio.com**

description:
!!! IMPORTANT !!!

 !!! IMPORTANT !!!
 



  





 Cikoria Embedded continues to grow and we are looking for system engineers.
 



 We have customers in all branches and you can expect assignments in anything from MedTech to autonomous vehicles. We carry out our assignments both in-house and at our customers. As we are a growing company, we also welcome you to explore other roles within the organization such as engineering manager or in sales.
 



 We have modern offices at Fridhemsplan, although most of us work remotely at the moment.
 



**About you** 




 We expect the following from you as a colleague:
 



 • We expect you to have a very high level of integrity. You will tell your boss (or the customer for that matter) if you think they are wrong.
 



 • We expect you to take pride in your work. You understand that your reputation (and ours) depends on a high-quality delivery every time.
 



 • We don't expect you to be an excellent communicator, but we do expect you to try. You understand that by talking to your customer, you reduce more project risks than anything else.
 



 • You speak and write both Swedish and English fluently.
 



**Qualifications** 




 You have several years of experience working as a system engineer or system architect, preferably in the embedded domain. You have experience working with safety-critical systems and/or cyber security. You have a master's degree or equivalent.
 



 Experience in the following areas is advantageous:
 



 · Software or hardware engineering
 



 · Requirement management
 



 · System Architecture
 



 · Troubleshooting/problem solving
 



 · Safety-critical and/or cybersecurity-related applications such as automotive, MedTech, rail, etc.
 



 · ISO/IEC/SAE-standards like 26262, 21434, 13489, 62304, 13485, 61508, 62443
 



 We look forward to your application!
 



  





 About Cikoria Embedded
 



 We are a young engineering company filled with senior engineers and we are building Sweden's leading consulting company in safety-critical embedded systems. We have modern offices in Stockholm City (Fridhemsplan). Our management system has been ISO 9001, 14001 and 27001 certified.
